intro: Cerasus juliana var. pendula, commonly known as weeping cherry or weeping peach, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to China. It is characterized by its pendulous branches that droop gracefully, creating a distinctive weeping appearance. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers in early spring, followed by small red fruits in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to both landscape design and ecological habitats.
